definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: CCS will not be liable for any loss due to any error of the applicant or any other person.
sentences.chinese: 本社对因申请方或他人的过错造成的损失不负责。
因此，产生了无过错责任。

sentences.english: Tactuality is no man but errs.
I acquit Edward of all essential misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 我原谅爱德华的所有根本过错。

sentences.english: Yes, we must suppose the faults of the niece to have been those of the aunt;
sentences.chinese: 是的，我们必须把侄女的过错视为婶母的过错。

sentences.english: Yes, we must suppose the faults of the niece to have been those of the aunt;
sentences.chinese: 是的，我们必须把侄女的过错视为婶母的过错。

sentences.english: There's nothing wrong with being the prettiest ballcock valve.
sentences.chinese: 当一个最漂亮的球形阀本身没有任何过错。

sentences.english: Drug manufacturers should bear the no-fault liability for drugs' warning defects.
sentences.chinese: 药品生产商对药品的警示缺陷应承担无过错责任。

sentences.english: The new《Marriage Law》sets up the divorce fault compensation system in our country firstly.
sentences.chinese: 新《婚姻法》在我国首次确立了离婚过错赔偿制度。

sentences.english: I told you I'm sorry. What can I do to make it up to you?
sentences.chinese: 我都跟你道歉了。我怎样做才能弥补我的过错？

sentences.english: The interim government is not blameless.
sentences.chinese: 临时政府并非没有过错。

sentences.english: Torts may be classified according to the gravity of the fault of the wrongdoer.
sentences.chinese: 侵权行为多半根据做坏事者过错的严重性来分类。

sentences.english: At first he denies it and Julie thinks it was her fault.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始扎克否认了这一点，朱莉也认为是自己的过错。

sentences.english: Don't keep jawing your little brother any more for his mistake.
sentences.chinese: 别再为你弟弟的过错训斥他了。

sentences.english: It also shows how mistakes made by children can easily break parents' hearts.
sentences.chinese: 而为人子女常犯的过错，又是如何摧折父母心。

definition: to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
at fault/blamed for/responsible (for a blunder or crime)
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
